oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This scrapbook, which consists of 217 images, was assembled by Pi Beta Phi Settlement School Head Resident Evelyn Bishop between 1919 and 1925. Many of the images in this book appear to have been taken by Settlement School teacher and Tacoma, Washington native Ruth Sturley, and are duplicates of those seen in the Ruth Sturley Scrapbook. This book is currently housed in the Arrowmont School of Arts and Crafts archives.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Gatlinburg From All Sides
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Sturley, Ruth
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For rights relating to this resource, visit: http://idserver.utk.edu/?id=200500000001941
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This scrapbook, which consists of 139 images, was assembled by Pi Beta Phi Settlement School teacher and Tacoma, Washington native Ruth Sturley in 1919. The book chronicles Sturley's nine month tenure in Gatlinburg, and includes images of the Settlement School, students, neighboring homesteads, and mountain vistas. It is currently housed in the archives of the Arrowmont School of Arts and Crafts.
